reviews.title: Great view, poor service , average food
reviews.text: We have stayed for 4 nights at Giardinetto and we've made the booking through 'Neckermann'. Excellent reviews about the room quality in this hotel refer most probably to 'superior rooms'. The same applies to all pictures you see on the internet about the room example in this hotel - it is about the 'superior' room. First 2 nights we have stayed in a 'standard' room, which I can qualify at max 2 stars. We had to change it and the whole situation has spoiled our first days there and our mood. So, make sure that you book a 'superior' room and not a 'standard' one, because the difference between them is huge. Overall speaking and comparing with other locations, 'great value for the money' IS NOT applicable for this hotel, because the rooms are quite expensive for the comfort it provides. We were also badly impressed about the fact that we've been the only young-middle age couple in the breakfast room, the rest being seniors and retired people. The quality of the breakfast was poor and especially the cleaning of the place/dishes was not so good. The last but not the least , the lady at the reception desk, a young person having black glasses , without badge and having a stiff behavior, was one of the most unfriendly person we've met during our travel around the world in the past years. She was heavily simulating politeness and 'professionalism' but was being harsh and unfriendly in reality.

The hotel restaurant is very well appreciated in all travel guides. We had there our dinner, during the first evening but we were not impressed at all, except the wine, that was ok. If you want a 'cuisine' like restaurant , go to the village, where the restaurant "Vecchio Forno' is located. You are going to see there what an excellent Italian cuisine is and what professional service means. We had our dinner there for all 3 remaining evenings and took advantage with great pleasure of all recommendations which the brunette lady owning the restaurant gracefully made to us each evening.
reviews.title: charming owner/wonderful staff

reviews.text: Had a delightful stay, everyone so friendly. We had to leave at 5 a.m. to catch a flight, so they set us up with coffee/sweets and a special clock.
reviews.title: Excellent value for money
Warm and Friendly Hotel
reviews.text: They have the new wake up call, but weren't sure it would work. Couldn't have been nicer. The food was great, the waiter spoke perfect English and was great, too. Thanks for a lovely evening.
Excellent food, right on the lake side. Wake up, roll out of bed and be in the water within two minutes.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, fabulous value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent two weeks at the Hotel Giardinetto and found this to be a charming hotel located right on the lake with magnificent views. As is usual with Italian hotels of a certain age the rooms and bathrooms are rather small, but ours was clean, comfortable and the air conditioning worked well and quietly. Our balcony had a fantastic view over the lake. We would not recommend a room at the rear of the hotel overlooking the road.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel - right on Lake Orta

reviews.text: The food was varied and of good quality and we enjoyed every meal. The wine list was wide and featured many local wines at modest prices.
reviews.title: Really terrible experience -- Left as soon as we could

likes.disliked: — The lack of cleanliness, the mold, and the rude management

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The one draw back with the location is that the hotel is on a busy road and it is rather dangerous for walking. It is not possible to walk to the Orta San Giulio and although the ferry stops right at the hotel jetty the frequency is such that one cannot have a few hours in Orta and return at a sensible time.
reviews.title: Gem of a family hotel on shores of Lake Orta

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We choose this holiday as we wished to walk in the area and once we found how to get off the main road there are many walks by the lake and in the hills and villages in the surrounding area. All these walks are clearly marked and many give stunning views over the lake.
reviews.title: Our 3rd visit & we still love it!!!

reviews.text: There is no reason why we would not return to this hotel.
reviews.title: where's the giardinetto?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Hotel Giardinetto for 3 nights and had a lovely time. The only slight draw back is that some rooms look onto the main road which means its noisy, myself and my fiance weren't bothered but my mum asked to move rooms, the staff were very accommodating and moved us all to rooms looking over the lake which were fabulous!
reviews.title: Really lovely hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was very nice but limited unless you enjoying dinning on the "posher" side of the menu.
reviews.title: Quiet rooms at extra costs

reviews.text: The hotel is in a beautiful position however you can not walk to Orta San Giulio, believe me we tried! There are ferry stops at the hotel and nearby but ferries were few and far between, one didn't even turn up which was a shame as we had such little time to explore beautiful Orta.
reviews.title: A very welcoming hotel with a good restaurant in a great lakeside location

reviews.text: You can walk partly along the lake, down to Hotel L'Approdo - this is a beautiful walk and clearly sign posted. The chapels at the top of town are stunning and worth the walk.
reviews.title: Pleasant hotel with delightful staff and the best view in the world

likes.liked: — view over lago d'orta, swimming in the lake before breakfast, delightful staff. good food
likes.disliked: — coffee at breakfast, Welsh coach party taking up too much space

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would definitely return to this hotel but would hire a car, although the hotel have their own mini bus which they use when they are able to spare the staff.
reviews.title: Great Family Run Hotel with views to die for

likes.liked: — The views, the wine and the food and the relaxing atmosphere
